title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 119.4 - Presentation of claimant's case
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 119.4 - Presentation of claimant's case

State Regulations

The claimant shall state his case upon commencement of the
proceeding. The claimant will have the opportunity at that time to offer proofs
in support of his claim, to call and examine any and all witnesses on his
behalf. Upon being sworn, the claimant may testify on his own behalf. In
addition to the presentation of the claimant's case, the hearing officer may
hear argument and entertain motions for dismissal or for other appropriate
relief. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 2

119.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
